column4: hey whats a program that will regulate my sound to one sound level?
I want my sound level to be even all the way through. im tired of quiet movies making me blast my speakers next time I play an MP3
Then you'll have to get every recording company in the world to record and burn things are the same volume
obviously you dont know such software DOES exist
Oh you mean that feature in itunes that automatically adjusts the volume?
It's in some audio players.  Amarok I believe has it.
I don't know.
what is the output of uname -a  ?
I'm not sure if there is a way to upgrade to 64 bit.
What is the output of free -m  ?
It's not that switching from 32 to 64 is dangerous.  It's impossible
And all the 32 bit libraries
And all the apps that depend on those libraries
haha
yeah probably
no offense but I do not think it is difficult or confusing to download 64bit Ubuntu
you are missing the point
Do you have a separate /home partition?
Yes.  It would mean you could fresh install without erasing home
You could create a partition, copy your home onto it and then reinstall and tell thei nstaller to use that partition
The system is designed to have /home on another partition. It will hurt absolutely nothing
There are tutorials on how to move from a single partition system to a 2 partition system ( / and /home ).  You could follow one and then when you install 64 bit simply point it at /home .
It is not pointless.  It's helpful for your reinstall
It's about the journey not the destination. :P
